column2: UTAH DMV PRACTICE TEST
column4: Utah
column6: UT

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text
column10: Answer4 Text

column2: 1. This regulatory road sign indicates that:
column4: The right hand lane is reserved for buses and car-pool vehicles.
column6: Vehicles must slow down and stay in the right lane.
column8: Slower vehicles must keep left.
column10: Slower vehicles traveling on multiple lane highways must stay in the right hand lane.

column2: 2. This sign warns drivers of:
column4: a reduction of lanes.
column6: a narrow road ahead.
column8: a bridge ahead, wide enough to accommodate two lanes of traffic, but with very little clearance.
column10: a dip in the road. Drivers should be ready to stop if the dip is filled with water.

column2: 3. At intersections where two or more drivers stop at STOP signs at the same time and they are at right angles:
column4: the driver who was going faster before stopping must yield.
column6: the driver on the left must yield to the driver on the right.
column8: the driver who is late for work has the right-of-way.
column10: the driver on the right must yield to the driver on the left.

column2: 4. This road sign means:
column4: Two way left turn
column6: No parking
column8: No U-Turn
column10: No right turn

column2: 5. Which shape is a speed limit sign?
column4: Pentagon
column6: Diamond
column8: Round
column10: Vertical rectangle

column2: 6. Which of the following is NOT true about ABS?
column4: It helps increase your stopping distance.
column6: It improves the steering ability.
column8: It improves the vehicle stability.
column10: It's an automobile safety system.

column2: 7. You may park or stop along the shoulder of the freeway:
column4: if you need to check your smartphone for directions.
column6: as long as you turn on your emergency flashers.
column8: only if you have an emergency.
column10: if no part of your vehicle is on the road.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
column4: Curve ahead
column6: Merging Traffic
column8: Wrong Way
column10: Road work ahead

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop and yield right-of-way
column6: Slow down and yield to traffic on main road when merging
column8: Lane reduction ahead
column10: Always come to a complete stop

column2: 10. This road sign means:
column4: You must come to a complete stop
column6: You may proceed at regular speed through the intersection
column8: Slow down and be prepared to stop if necessary
column10: Wrong Way

column2: 11. __________ limit(s) your concentration, perception, judgment, and memory.
column4: Even the smallest amount of alcohol
column6: Only a blood alcohol level greater than the legal limit
column8: Alcohol does not
column10: Only a blood alcohol level greater than .05

column2: 12. A red traffic sign means?
column4: Wrong way.
column6: Stop.
column8: Do not enter.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 13. What should you do if your vision through the windshield becomes blocked?
column4: Open the side window so you can see.
column6: Pull your vehicle off the road and park it.
column8: Turn on your emergency lights.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 14. It's 10 AM. This sign tells you that:
column4: you must display a special permit in order to park here.
column6: you are not allowed to park here.
column8: you must park your car between 8:30 AM and 5:30 PM.
column10: you are allowed to park until 5:30 PM.

column2: 15. This sign indicates:
column4: Cell phone shop ahead
column6: Emergency line available
column8: Do not use your phone while driving
column10: Phone service ahead

column2: 16. A common mistake that drivers make is driving without adequate rest.
column4: True
column6: False

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: Sharp right turn
column6: Winding road ahead
column8: A road joins from the left
column10: The road ahead turns sharply right then sharply left

column2: 18. Drivers can proceed through an intersection with a stop sign, but no stop line or crosswalk:
column4: after coming to a complete stop, when it is safe to proceed.
column6: after slowing down to ensure there is no cross-traffic.
column8: after stopping at least 50 feet prior to the intersection.
column10: after slowing down to at least 15 MPH before proceeding.

column2: 19. It is important for drivers to know that trucks:
column4: are easier for the driver to operate.
column6: require more space for turning movements.
column8: take longer than cars to stop.
column10: require less time to pass on an incline than cars.

column2: 20. When drivers see the ‘Wrong Way’ sign:
column4: they must not leave the pavement except in an emergency.
column6: they are going the wrong way on an expressway exit ramp.
column8: they must stop immediately.
column10: they must drive past this sign and reach the next intersection.

column2: 21. This sign means:
column4: Double curve ahead.
column6: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column8: The road will curve to the right, then to the left.
column10: Road slippery when wet. Drive slowly.

column2: 22. Drive below the posted speed limit when:
column4: you are on a four lane road.
column6: others drive below the speed limit.
column8: entering a highway where there are other cars.
column10: anything makes conditions less than perfect.

column2: 23. Drivers under 21 years of age are considered to be driving under the influence if their blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
column4: .02% or higher.
column6: .05% or higher.
column8: .10% or higher.
column10: .08% or higher.

column2: 24. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column4: to signal all lane changes.
column6: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.
column8: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 25. What does a yellow arrow signal mean?
column4: Vehicles moving in all directions must stop if they can. The light will soon be red.
column6: The same as a green light.
column8: The same as the yellow light, but applies only to movement in the direction of the arrow.
column10: None of the above.
